articles.content: A new study of thousands of hospitalized coronavirus patients in the New York City area, the epicenter of the outbreak in the United States, has found that nearly all of them had at least one major chronic health condition, and most 88 percent had at least tw… [+5691 chars]

articles.author: Denise Whitaker
articles.title: New COVID-19 side effect in people under 50 - KOMO News
articles.description: Doctors in New York say a growing number of their coronavirus patients in their 30s and 40s are suffering sudden strokes. This new side effect comes from the staff at Mt Sinai Health, after seeing blood clot in unusual ways in these younger patients who were …

articles.author: David Moye
articles.title: Purplish Lesions On Feet Could Be Sign Of Virus, Say Dermatologists - HuffPost
articles.description: Doctors say "COVID toes" could be a way to track the coronavirus in otherwise asymptomatic patients.
articles.content:
Dermatologists say looking at a person’s feet may be a handy way of seeing if someone has the coronavirus.
It seems that many otherwise asymptomatic people are reporting the presence of painful purplish lesions on their toes.
The so-called “COVID toes” are … [+2847 chars]

articles.title: A mysterious blood-clotting complication is killing coronavirus patients - Boston.com
articles.description: Increasingly, doctors are reporting bizarre, unsettling cases that don't seem to follow any of the textbooks they've trained on.
articles.content:
Craig Coopersmith was up early that morning as usual and typed his daily inquiry into his phone. Good morning, Team Covid, he wrote, asking for updates from the ICU team leaders working across 10 hospitals in the Emory University health system in Atlanta.
